meanings.definition: A jump in figure skating where the skater takes off from the forward outside edge of one skate and makes one and a half turns in the air before landing on the back outside edge of the other skate.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, she executed a flawless axel, impressing the judges.
meanings.sent2: The young skater practiced her axel repeatedly to perfect her technique.
meanings.sent3: The penguin attempted an axel on the ice, causing the audience to chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence soared as she nailed the axel, feeling like she could conquer anything.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight gleamed on her as she gracefully completed the axel, captivating the crowd.

meanings.definition: A figure skating move in which the skater jumps from the front outer edge of one skate to the back outer edge of the other skate.
meanings.sent1: The skater's axel was the highlight of her performance, drawing cheers from the audience.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to land the axel smoothly during practice but eventually improved.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted an axel on the ice, causing laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: Her axel was like a swift transition from day to night, seamless and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The music swirled around her as she executed the axel, creating a mesmerizing moment.

meanings.definition: A figure skating jump with a forward takeoff and one and a half turns in the air.
meanings.sent1: The young skater's axel was a key element in her routine, showcasing her skill.
meanings.sent2: She practiced the axel diligently, aiming to make it the highlight of her performance.
meanings.sent3: The dog attempted an axel on the frozen pond, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His axel was like a whirlwind of motion, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The crowd gasped as she flawlessly executed the axel, leaving a lasting impression.
